remarks: A "closed subspace" in a complex pre-Hilbert space is actually closed in the topology induced by the norm, thus justifying the terminology "closed subspace".  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Oct-2015.)
statement:
csscld.c $e |- C = ( CSubSp ` W ) $.
csscld.j $e |- J = ( TopOpen ` W ) $.
csscld $p |- ( ( W e. CPreHil /\ S e. C ) -> S e. ( Clsd ` J ) ) $.
